newsitem.title: USA: Micro Warehouse faces new suit - lawyers.
newsitem.headline: Micro Warehouse faces new suit - lawyers.

text.p: Micro Warehouse Inc shareholders filed a class action suit against the company, alleging Micro Warehouse violated U.S. federal securities law, the plaintiff's lawyers said.

The lawyers said the suit was filed on behalf of shareholders who purchased Micro Warehouse between March 20, 1995, and September 30, 1996, and those who acquired Micro Warehouse shares after its acquisition of Inmac Corp.
It charged that Micro and some officers and directors allegedly misrepresented Micro's financial state and results, to complete acquisitions in the class period, lawyers said.
The company was not immediately available to comment on the suit.

Plaintiffs alleged that defendants also misrepresented Micro's financial results partly to effectuate sales of Micro stock by corporate insiders and to make acquisitions via stock swaps, the lawyers said.
Micro Warehouse said on September 30 it would likely restate its fiancial results for its 1994 and 1995 fiscal years after finding errors in its accounting procedures.

The plaintiffs were represented by, among others, law firms Lowey, Dannenberg, Bemporad & Selinger P.C., Schatz & Nobel P.C., and Goodkind Labaton Rudoff & Sucharow LLP. The suit was filed in the U.S. District Court of Connecticut.
